page.title: 16CROSSFORD SCOUTS: NEW HALL
page.content: The 62nd Fife (Crossford) Scout Group at present use Crossford Village Hall for their Tuesday night meetings, but the village has expanded so much in the past ten years that pressure of numbers in the Group itself, and from other organisations also wanting to use the village hall, have lead to plans to build a new hut for the Group. A site has been arranged in the King George V playing fields, and now the sum of Â£48,000 has to be raised. Grants and loans are helping, but the Group has still to find Â£6,000 itself, so a series of fund raising events, including raffles and sponsored runs, are being arranged. Hopefully soon the 30 scouts, 24 cub-scouts and 20 beavers will have a regular meeting place of their own.
